title: House to Vote on Resolution, Opposed by Turkey, to Mark Armenian Genocide
text:
The House is poised to vote next week on a resolution to commemorate the Armenian genocide perpetrated by the Ottoman Empire, a move that supporters say is driven in part by fears of potential Turkish atrocities against the Kurds in northern Syria.

The issue of whether the U.S. should recognize what happened to the Armenians from 1915 to 1923 as genocide—as most historians do—has been the subject of a yearslong lobbying and diplomatic battle. Congress has considered moving a similar resolution a handful of times over the last...
